alert.note: Alert for Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Northern Washoe County; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 8:24PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with Heavy Rain Continue Across Western Nevada through 915 PM PDT... At 820 PM PDT, meteorologists continue to track strong thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall and copious lightning over the Basin and Range of Western Nevada. These thunderstorms are moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall with rates up to 1 inch per hour, gusty winds to 30 mph, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding of low spots and poor drainage areas. Low visibility within heavy rain. Frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. Locations impacted include... Fallon, Lovelock, Pyramid Lake, Lahontan Reservoir, Gerlach, Fernley, Virginia Peak, Oreana, Middlegate, Derby Dam, Trinity Junction, Sutcliffe, Hazen, Imlay, Stillwater, Unionville, Nixon, Gerlach-Empire, Silver Springs, and Spanish Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Remember to slow down and turn on your headlights in heavy rain. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
